snippet: The F.D.A. approved Avastin on Thursday for women with cervical cancer that is persistent, recurrent or has spread to other parts of the body.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration approves Avastin, drug made by Genentech, for use against late-stage cervical cancer; approval marks seventh approved use for biotech drug.
lead_paragraph: The F.D.A. approved Avastin on Thursday for women with cervical cancer that is persistent, recurrent or has spread to other parts of the body.

headline.main: Drug Is Approved as Treatment for Cervical Cancer
headline.print_headline: Drug Is Approved as Treatment for Cervical Cancer
